00026 
00027 int
00028 wapi_get_we_version(int sock, const char *ifname, int *we_version)
00029 {
00030     struct iwreq wrq;
00031     char buf[sizeof(struct iw_range) * 2];
00032     int ret;
00033 
00034     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(we_version);
00035 
00036     /* Prepare request. */
00037     bzero(buf, sizeof(buf));
00038     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00039     wrq.u.data.length = sizeof(buf);
00040     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00041 
00042     /* Get WE version. */
00043     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00044     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRANGE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00045     {
00046         struct iw_range *range = (struct iw_range *) buf;
00047         *we_version = (int) range->we_version_compiled;
00048     }
00049     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRANGE);
00050 
00051     return ret;
00052 }

00055 /*-- Frequency ---------------------------------------------------------------*/
00056 
00057 
00058 const char *wapi_freq_flags[] = {
00059     "WAPI_FREQ_AUTO",
00060     "WAPI_FREQ_FIXED"
00061 };
00062 
00063 
00064 /**
00065  * Converts internal representation of frequencies to a floating point.
00066  */
00067 static inline double
00068 wapi_freq2float(const struct iw_freq *freq)
00069 {
00070     return ((double) freq->m) * pow(10, freq->e);
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * Converts a floating point the our internal representation of frequencies.
00076  */
00077 static inline void
00078 wapi_float2freq(double floatfreq, struct iw_freq *freq)
00079 {
00080     freq->e = (short) floor(log10(floatfreq));
00081     if (freq->e > 8)
00082     {
00083         freq->m = ((long) (floor(floatfreq / pow(10,freq->e - 6)))) * 100;
00084         freq->e -= 8;
00085     }
00086     else
00087     {
00088         freq->m = (long) floatfreq;
00089         freq->e = 0;
00090     }
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 int
00095 wapi_get_freq(int sock, const char *ifname, double *freq, wapi_freq_flag_t *flag)
00096 {
00097     struct iwreq wrq;
00098     int ret;
00099 
00100     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(freq);
00101     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00102 
00103     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00104     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWFREQ, &wrq)) >= 0)
00105     {
00106         /* Set flag. */
00107         if (IW_FREQ_AUTO == (wrq.u.freq.flags & IW_FREQ_AUTO))
00108             *flag = WAPI_FREQ_AUTO;
00109         else if (IW_FREQ_FIXED == (wrq.u.freq.flags & IW_FREQ_FIXED))
00110             *flag = WAPI_FREQ_FIXED;
00111         else
00112         {
00113             WAPI_ERROR("Unknown flag: %d.\n", wrq.u.freq.flags);
00114             return -1;
00115         }
00116 
00117         /* Set freq. */
00118         *freq = wapi_freq2float(&(wrq.u.freq));
00119     }
00120 
00121     return ret;
00122 }
00123 
00124 
00125 int
00126 wapi_set_freq(int sock, const char *ifname, double freq, wapi_freq_flag_t flag)
00127 {
00128     struct iwreq wrq;
00129     int ret;
00130 
00131     /* Set freq. */
00132     wapi_float2freq(freq, &(wrq.u.freq));
00133 
00134     /* Set flag. */
00135     switch (flag)
00136     {
00137     case WAPI_FREQ_AUTO:
00138         wrq.u.freq.flags = IW_FREQ_AUTO;
00139         break;
00140     case WAPI_FREQ_FIXED:
00141         wrq.u.freq.flags = IW_FREQ_FIXED;
00142         break;
00143     }
00144 
00145     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00146     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWFREQ, &wrq);
00147     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWFREQ);
00148 
00149     return ret;
00150 }
00151 
00152 
00153 int
00154 wapi_freq2chan(int sock, const char *ifname, double freq, int *chan)
00155 {
00156     struct iwreq wrq;
00157     char buf[sizeof(struct iw_range) * 2];
00158     int ret;
00159 
00160     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(chan);
00161 
00162     /* Prepare request. */
00163     bzero(buf, sizeof(buf));
00164     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00165     wrq.u.data.length = sizeof(buf);
00166     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00167 
00168     /* Get range. */
00169     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00170     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRANGE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00171     {
00172         struct iw_range *range = (struct iw_range *) buf;
00173         int k;
00174 
00175         /* Compare the frequencies as double to ignore differences in encoding.
00176          * Slower, but safer... */
00177         for (k = 0; k < range->num_frequency; k++)
00178             if (freq == wapi_freq2float(&(range->freq[k])))
00179             {
00180                 *chan = range->freq[k].i;
00181                 return 0;
00182             }
00183 
00184         /* Oops! Nothing found. */
00185         WAPI_ERROR("No channel matches for the given frequency!\n");
00186         ret = -2;
00187     }
00188     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRANGE);
00189 
00190     return ret;
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 int
00195 wapi_chan2freq(int sock, const char *ifname, int chan, double *freq)
00196 {
00197     struct iwreq wrq;
00198     char buf[sizeof(struct iw_range) * 2];
00199     int ret;
00200 
00201     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(freq);
00202 
00203     /* Prepare request. */
00204     bzero(buf, sizeof(buf));
00205     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00206     wrq.u.data.length = sizeof(buf);
00207     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00208 
00209     /* Get range. */
00210     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00211     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRANGE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00212     {
00213         struct iw_range *range = (struct iw_range *) buf;
00214         int k;
00215 
00216         for (k = 0; k < range->num_frequency; k++)
00217             if (chan == range->freq[k].i)
00218             {
00219                 *freq = wapi_freq2float(&(range->freq[k]));
00220                 return 0;
00221             }
00222 
00223         /* Oops! Nothing found. */
00224         WAPI_ERROR("No frequency matches for the given channel!\n");
00225         ret = -2;
00226     }
00227     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRANGE);
00228 
00229     return ret;
00230 }

00241 
00242 int
00243 wapi_get_essid(
00244     int sock,
00245     const char *ifname,
00246     char *essid,
00247     wapi_essid_flag_t *flag)
00248 {
00249     struct iwreq wrq;
00250     int ret;
00251 
00252     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(essid);
00253     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00254 
00255     wrq.u.essid.pointer = essid;
00256     wrq.u.essid.length = WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1;
00257     wrq.u.essid.flags = 0;
00258 
00259     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00260     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWESSID, &wrq);
00261     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWESSID);
00262     else *flag = (wrq.u.essid.flags) ? WAPI_ESSID_ON : WAPI_ESSID_OFF;
00263 
00264     return ret;
00265 }

00267 
00268 int
00269 wapi_set_essid(
00270     int sock,
00271     const char *ifname,
00272     const char *essid,
00273     wapi_essid_flag_t flag)
00274 {
00275     char buf[WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1];
00276     struct iwreq wrq;
00277     int ret;
00278 
00279     /* Prepare request. */
00280     wrq.u.essid.pointer = buf;
00281     wrq.u.essid.length =
00282         snprintf(buf, ((WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1) * sizeof(char)), "%s", essid);
00283     wrq.u.essid.flags = (flag == WAPI_ESSID_ON);
00284 
00285     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00286     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWESSID, &wrq);
00287     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWESSID);
00288 
00289     return ret;
00290 }

00306 
00307 static int
00308 wapi_parse_mode(int iw_mode, wapi_mode_t *wapi_mode)
00309 {
00310     switch (iw_mode)
00311     {
00312     case WAPI_MODE_AUTO:
00313     case WAPI_MODE_ADHOC:
00314     case WAPI_MODE_MANAGED:
00315     case WAPI_MODE_MASTER:
00316     case WAPI_MODE_REPEAT:
00317     case WAPI_MODE_SECOND:
00318     case WAPI_MODE_MONITOR:
00319         *wapi_mode = iw_mode;
00320         return 0;
00321 
00322     default:
00323         WAPI_ERROR("Unknown mode: %d.\n", iw_mode);
00324         return -1;
00325     }
00326 }
00327 
00328 
00329 int
00330 wapi_get_mode(int sock, const char *ifname, wapi_mode_t *mode)
00331 {
00332     struct iwreq wrq;
00333     int ret;
00334 
00335     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(mode);
00336 
00337     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00338     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWMODE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00339         ret = wapi_parse_mode(wrq.u.mode, mode);
00340     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWMODE);
00341 
00342     return ret;
00343 }

00366 wapi_make_ether(struct ether_addr *addr, int byte)

00388 int
00389 wapi_get_ap(int sock, const char *ifname, struct ether_addr *ap)
00390 {
00391     struct iwreq wrq;
00392     int ret;
00393 
00394     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(ap);
00395 
00396     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00397     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWAP, &wrq)) >= 0)
00398         memcpy(ap, wrq.u.ap_addr.sa_data, sizeof(struct ether_addr));
00399     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWAP);
00400 
00401     return ret;
00402 }

00404 
00405 int
00406 wapi_set_ap(int sock, const char *ifname, const struct ether_addr *ap)
00407 {
00408     struct iwreq wrq;
00409     int ret;
00410 
00411     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(ap);
00412 
00413     wrq.u.ap_addr.sa_family = ARPHRD_ETHER;
00414     memcpy(wrq.u.ap_addr.sa_data, ap, sizeof(struct ether_addr));
00415     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00416     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWAP, &wrq);
00417     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWAP);
00418 
00419     return ret;
00420 }

00428     "WAPI_BITRATE_FIXED"

00431 
00432 int
00433 wapi_get_bitrate(
00434     int sock,
00435     const char *ifname,
00436     int *bitrate,
00437     wapi_bitrate_flag_t *flag)
00438 {
00439     struct iwreq wrq;
00440     int ret;
00441 
00442     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(bitrate);
00443     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00444 
00445     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00446     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRATE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00447     {
00448         /* Check if enabled. */
00449         if (wrq.u.bitrate.disabled)
00450         {
00451             WAPI_ERROR("Bitrate is disabled.\n");
00452             return -1;
00453         }
00454 
00455         /* Get bitrate. */
00456         *bitrate = wrq.u.bitrate.value;
00457         *flag = wrq.u.bitrate.fixed ? WAPI_BITRATE_FIXED : WAPI_BITRATE_AUTO;
00458     }
00459     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRATE);
00460 
00461     return ret;
00462 }
00463

00465 int
00466 wapi_set_bitrate(
00467     int sock,
00468     const char *ifname,
00469     int bitrate,
00470     wapi_bitrate_flag_t flag)
00471 {
00472     struct iwreq wrq;
00473     int ret;
00474 
00475     wrq.u.bitrate.value = bitrate;
00476     wrq.u.bitrate.fixed = (flag == WAPI_BITRATE_FIXED);
00477 
00478     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00479     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWRATE, &wrq);
00480     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWRATE);
00481 
00482     return ret;
00483 }

00487 
00488 
00489 const char *wapi_txpower_flags[] = {
00490     "WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM",
00491     "WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT",
00492     "WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE"
00493 };
00494 
00495 
00496 int
00497 wapi_dbm2mwatt(int dbm)
00498 {
00499     return floor(pow(10, (((double) dbm) / 10)));
00500 }
00501 
00502 
00503 int
00504 wapi_mwatt2dbm(int mwatt)
00505 {
00506     return ceil(10 * log10(mwatt));
00507 }
00508 
00509 
00510 int
00511 wapi_get_txpower(
00512     int sock,
00513     const char *ifname,
00514     int *power,
00515     wapi_txpower_flag_t *flag)
00516 {
00517     struct iwreq wrq;
00518     int ret;
00519 
00520     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(power);
00521     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00522 
00523     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00524     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWTXPOW, &wrq)) >= 0)
00525     {
00526         /* Check if enabled. */
00527         if (wrq.u.txpower.disabled)
00528             return -1;
00529 
00530         /* Get flag. */
00531         if (IW_TXPOW_DBM == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_DBM))
00532             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM;
00533         else if (IW_TXPOW_MWATT == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_MWATT))
00534             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT;
00535         else if (IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE))
00536             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE;
00537         else
00538         {
00539             WAPI_ERROR("Unknown flag: %d.\n", wrq.u.txpower.flags);
00540             return -1;
00541         }
00542 
00543         /* Get power. */
00544         *power = wrq.u.txpower.value;
00545     }
00546     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWTXPOW);
00547 
00548     return ret;
00549 }
00550 
00551 
00552 int
00553 wapi_set_txpower(
00554     int sock,
00555     const char *ifname,
00556     int power,
00557     wapi_txpower_flag_t flag)
00558 {
00559     struct iwreq wrq;
00560     int ret;
00561 
00562     /* Construct the request. */
00563     wrq.u.txpower.value = power;
00564     switch (flag)
00565     {
00566     case WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM:
00567         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_DBM;
00568         break;
00569     case WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT:
00570         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_MWATT;
00571         break;
00572     case WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE:
00573         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE;
00574         break;
00575     }
00576 
00577     /* Issue the set command. */
00578     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00579     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWTXPOW, &wrq);
00580     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWTXPOW);
00581 
00582     return ret;
00583 }

00588 
00589 struct iw_event_stream {
00590     char *end;      /* end of the stream */
00591     char *current;  /* current event in stream of events */
00592     char *value;        /* current value in event */
00593 };
00594 
00595 
00596 static void
00597 iw_event_stream_init(struct iw_event_stream *stream, char *data, size_t len)
00598 {
00599     memset(stream, 0, sizeof(struct iw_event_stream));
00600     stream->current = data;
00601     stream->end = &data[len];
00602 }
00603 
00604 
00605 static int
00606 iw_event_stream_pop(
00607     struct iw_event_stream *stream,
00608     struct iw_event *iwe,
00609     int we_version)
00610 {
00611     return iw_extract_event_stream(
00612         (struct stream_descr *) stream, iwe, we_version);
00613 }

00616 /*-- Scanning ----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00617 
00618 
00619 int
00620 wapi_scan_init(int sock, const char *ifname)
00621 {
00622     struct iwreq wrq;
00623     int ret;
00624 
00625     wrq.u.data.pointer = NULL;
00626     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00627     wrq.u.data.length = 0;
00628 
00629     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00630     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWSCAN, &wrq);
00631     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWSCAN);
00632 
00633     return ret;
00634 }
00635 
00636 
00637 int
00638 wapi_scan_stat(int sock, const char *ifname)
00639 {
00640     struct iwreq wrq;
00641     int ret;
00642     char buf;
00643 
00644     wrq.u.data.pointer = &buf;
00645     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00646     wrq.u.data.length = 0;
00647 
00648     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00649     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWSCAN, &wrq)) < 0)
00650     {
00651         if (errno == E2BIG)
00652             /* Data is ready, but not enough space, which is expected. */
00653             return 0;
00654         else if (errno == EAGAIN)
00655             /* Data is not ready. */
00656             return 1;
00657 
00658         printf("err[%d]: %s\n", errno, strerror(errno));
00659     }
00660     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWSCAN);
00661 
00662     return ret;
00663 }
00664 
00665 
00666 static int
00667 wapi_scan_event(struct iw_event *event, wapi_list_t *list)
00668 {
00669     wapi_scan_info_t *info;
00670 
00671     /* Get current "wapi_info_t". */
00672     info = list->head.scan;
00673 
00674     /* Decode the event. */
00675     switch (event->cmd)
00676     {
00677     case SIOCGIWAP:
00678     {
00679         wapi_scan_info_t *temp;
00680 
00681         /* Allocate a new cell. */
00682         temp = malloc(sizeof(wapi_scan_info_t));
00683         if (!temp)
00684         {
00685             WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00686             return -1;
00687         }
00688 
00689         /* Reset it. */
00690         bzero(temp, sizeof(wapi_scan_info_t));
00691 
00692         /* Save cell identifier. */
00693         memcpy(&temp->ap, &event->u.ap_addr.sa_data, sizeof(struct ether_addr));
00694 
00695         /* Push it to the head of the list. */
00696         temp->next = info;
00697         list->head.scan = temp;
00698         
00699         break;
00700     }
00701 
00702     case SIOCGIWFREQ:
00703         info->has_freq = 1;
00704         info->freq = wapi_freq2float(&(event->u.freq));
00705         break;
00706 
00707     case SIOCGIWMODE:
00708     {
00709         int ret = wapi_parse_mode(event->u.mode, &info->mode);
00710         if (ret >= 0)
00711         {
00712             info->has_mode = 1;
00713             break;
00714         }
00715         else return ret;
00716     }
00717 
00718     case SIOCGIWESSID:
00719         info->has_essid = 1;
00720         info->essid_flag = (event->u.data.flags) ? WAPI_ESSID_ON : WAPI_ESSID_OFF;
00721         memset(info->essid, 0, (WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1));
00722         if ((event->u.essid.pointer) && (event->u.essid.length))
00723             memcpy(info->essid, event->u.essid.pointer, event->u.essid.length);
00724         break;
00725 
00726     case SIOCGIWRATE:
00727         /* Scan may return a list of bitrates. As we have space for only a
00728          * single bitrate, we only keep the largest one. */
00729         if (!info->has_bitrate || event->u.bitrate.value > info->bitrate)
00730         {
00731             info->has_bitrate = 1;
00732             info->bitrate = event->u.bitrate.value;
00733         }
00734         break;
00735     }
00736 
00737     return 0;
00738 }
00739 
00740 
00741 int
00742 wapi_scan_coll(int sock, const char *ifname, wapi_list_t *aps)
00743 {
00744     char *buf;
00745     int buflen;
00746     struct iwreq wrq;
00747     int we_version;
00748     int ret;
00749 
00750     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(aps);
00751 
00752     /* Get WE version. (Required for event extraction via libiw.) */
00753     if ((ret = wapi_get_we_version(sock, ifname, &we_version)) < 0)
00754         return ret;
00755 
00756     buflen = IW_SCAN_MAX_DATA;
00757     buf = malloc(buflen * sizeof(char));
00758     if (!buf)
00759     {
00760         WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00761         return -1;
00762     }
00763 
00764 alloc:
00765     /* Collect results. */
00766     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00767     wrq.u.data.length = buflen;
00768     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00769     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00770     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWSCAN, &wrq)) < 0 && errno == E2BIG)
00771     {
00772         char *tmp;
00773 
00774         buflen *= 2;
00775         tmp = realloc(buf, buflen);
00776         if (!tmp)
00777         {
00778             WAPI_STRERROR("realloc()");
00779             free(buf);
00780             return -1;
00781         }
00782 
00783         buf = tmp;
00784         goto alloc;
00785     }
00786 
00787     /* There is still something wrong. It's either EAGAIN or some other ioctl()
00788      * failure. We don't bother, let the user deal with it. */
00789     if (ret < 0)
00790     {
00791         WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWSCAN);
00792         free(buf);
00793         return ret;
00794     }
00795 
00796     /* We have the results, process them. */
00797     if (wrq.u.data.length)
00798     {
00799         struct iw_event iwe;
00800         struct iw_event_stream stream;
00801 
00802         iw_event_stream_init(&stream, buf, wrq.u.data.length);
00803         do {
00804             if ((ret = iw_event_stream_pop(&stream, &iwe, we_version)) >= 0)
00805             {
00806                 int eventret = wapi_scan_event(&iwe, aps);
00807                 if (eventret < 0)
00808                     ret = eventret;
00809             }
00810             else WAPI_ERROR("iw_event_stream_pop() failed!\n");
00811         } while (ret > 0);
00812     }
00813 
00814     /* Free request buffer. */
00815     free(buf);
00816 
00817     return ret;
00818 }
00819 
00820 
00821 /*-- Add/Del Interface -------------------------------------------------------*/
00822 
00823 
00824 typedef enum {
00825     WAPI_NL80211_CMD_IFADD,
00826     WAPI_NL80211_CMD_IFDEL
00827 } wapi_nl80211_cmd_t;
00828 
00829 
00830 typedef struct wapi_nl80211_ifadd_ctx_t {
00831     const char *name;
00832     wapi_mode_t mode;
00833 } wapi_nl80211_ifadd_ctx_t;
00834 
00835 
00836 typedef struct wapi_nl80211_ifdel_ctx_t {
00837 } wapi_nl80211_ifdel_ctx_t;
00838 
00839 
00840 typedef struct wapi_nl80211_ctx_t {
00841     const char *ifname;
00842     wapi_nl80211_cmd_t cmd;
00843     union {
00844         wapi_nl80211_ifadd_ctx_t ifadd;
00845         wapi_nl80211_ifdel_ctx_t ifdel;
00846     } u;
00847 } wapi_nl80211_ctx_t;
00848 
00849 
00850 #ifdef LIBNL1
00851 #define nl_sock nl_handle
00852 
00853 
00854 static struct nl_handle *nl_socket_alloc(void)
00855 {
00856     return nl_handle_alloc();
00857 }
00858 
00859 
00860 static void nl_socket_free(struct nl_sock *h)
00861 {
00862     nl_handle_destroy(h);
00863 }
00864 #endif
00865 
00866 
00867 static int
00868 wapi_mode_to_iftype(wapi_mode_t mode, enum nl80211_iftype *type)
00869 {
00870     int ret = 0;
00871 
00872     switch (mode)
00873     {
00874     case WAPI_MODE_AUTO:    *type = NL80211_IFTYPE_UNSPECIFIED; break;
00875     case WAPI_MODE_ADHOC:   *type = NL80211_IFTYPE_ADHOC;       break;
00876     case WAPI_MODE_MANAGED: *type = NL80211_IFTYPE_STATION;     break;
00877     case WAPI_MODE_MASTER:  *type = NL80211_IFTYPE_AP;          break;
00878     case WAPI_MODE_MONITOR: *type = NL80211_IFTYPE_MONITOR;     break;
00879     default:
00880         WAPI_ERROR(
00881             "No supported nl80211 iftype for mode: %s!\n",
00882             wapi_modes[mode]);
00883         ret = -1;
00884     }
00885 
00886     return ret;
00887 }
00888 
00889 
00890 static int
00891 nl80211_err_handler(struct sockaddr_nl *nla, struct nlmsgerr *err, void *arg)
00892 {
00893     int *ret = arg;
00894     *ret = err->error;
00895     return NL_STOP;
00896 }
00897 
00898 
00899 static int
00900 nl80211_fin_handler(struct nl_msg *msg, void *arg)
00901 {
00902     int *ret = arg;
00903     *ret = 0;
00904     return NL_SKIP;
00905 }
00906 
00907 
00908 static int
00909 nl80211_ack_handler(struct nl_msg *msg, void *arg)
00910 {
00911     int *ret = arg;
00912     *ret = 0;
00913     return NL_STOP;
00914 }
00915 
00916 
00917 static int
00918 nl80211_cmd_handler(const wapi_nl80211_ctx_t *ctx)
00919 {
00920     struct nl_sock *sock;
00921     struct nl_msg *msg;
00922     struct nl_cb *cb;
00923     int family;
00924     int ifidx;
00925     int ret;
00926 
00927     /* Allocate netlink socket. */
00928     sock = nl_socket_alloc();
00929     if (!sock)
00930     {
00931         WAPI_ERROR("Failed to allocate netlink socket!\n");
00932         return -ENOMEM;
00933     }
00934 
00935     /* Reset "msg" and "cb". */
00936     msg = NULL;
00937     cb = NULL;
00938 
00939     /* Connect to generic netlink socket on kernel side. */
00940     if (genl_connect(sock))
00941     {
00942         WAPI_ERROR("Failed to connect to generic netlink!\n");
00943         ret = -ENOLINK;
00944         goto exit;
00945     }
00946 
00947     /* Ask kernel to resolve family name to family id. */
00948     ret = family = genl_ctrl_resolve(sock, "nl80211");
00949     if (ret < 0)
00950     {
00951         WAPI_ERROR("genl_ctrl_resolve() failed!\n");
00952         goto exit;
00953     }
00954 
00955     /* Map given network interface name (ifname) to its corresponding index. */
00956     ifidx = if_nametoindex(ctx->ifname);
00957     if (!ifidx)
00958     {
00959         WAPI_STRERROR("if_nametoindex(\"%s\")", ctx->ifname);
00960         ret = -errno;
00961         goto exit;
00962     }
00963 
00964     /* Construct a generic netlink by allocating a new message. */
00965     msg = nlmsg_alloc();
00966     if (!msg)
00967     {
00968         WAPI_ERROR("nlmsg_alloc() failed!\n");
00969         ret = -ENOMEM;
00970         goto exit;
00971     }
00972 
00973     /* Append the requested command to the message. */
00974     switch (ctx->cmd)
00975     {
00976     case WAPI_NL80211_CMD_IFADD:
00977     {
00978         enum nl80211_iftype iftype;
00979 
00980         genlmsg_put(
00981             msg, NL_AUTO_PID, NL_AUTO_SEQ, family, 0, 0,
00982             NL80211_CMD_NEW_INTERFACE, 0);
00983         NLA_PUT_U32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_IFINDEX, ifidx);
00984 
00985         /* Get NL80211_IFTYPE_* for the given WAPI mode. */
00986         ret = wapi_mode_to_iftype(ctx->u.ifadd.mode, &iftype);
00987         if (ret < 0) goto exit;
00988 
00989         NLA_PUT_STRING(msg, NL80211_ATTR_IFNAME, ctx->u.ifadd.name);
00990         NLA_PUT_U32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_IFTYPE, iftype);
00991 
00992         break;
00993     }
00994 
00995     case WAPI_NL80211_CMD_IFDEL:
00996         genlmsg_put(
00997             msg, NL_AUTO_PID, NL_AUTO_SEQ, family, 0, 0,
00998             NL80211_CMD_DEL_INTERFACE, 0);
00999         NLA_PUT_U32(msg, NL80211_ATTR_IFINDEX, ifidx);
01000         break;
01001     }
01002 
01003     /* Finalize (send) the message. */
01004     ret = nl_send_auto_complete(sock, msg);
01005     if (ret < 0)
01006     {
01007         WAPI_ERROR("nl_send_auto_complete() failed!\n");
01008         goto exit;
01009     }
01010 
01011     /* Allocate a new callback handle. */
01012     cb = nl_cb_alloc(NL_CB_VERBOSE);
01013     if (!cb)
01014     {
01015         WAPI_ERROR("nl_cb_alloc() failed\n");
01016         ret = -1;
01017         goto exit;
01018     }
01019 
01020     /* Configure callback handlers. */
01021     nl_cb_err(cb, NL_CB_CUSTOM, nl80211_err_handler, &ret);
01022     nl_cb_set(cb, NL_CB_FINISH, NL_CB_CUSTOM, nl80211_fin_handler, &ret);
01023     nl_cb_set(cb, NL_CB_ACK, NL_CB_CUSTOM, nl80211_ack_handler, &ret);
01024 
01025     /* Consume netlink replies. */
01026     for (ret = 1; ret > 0; ) nl_recvmsgs(sock, cb);
01027     if (ret) WAPI_ERROR("nl_recvmsgs() failed!\n");
01028 
01029 exit:
01030     /* Release resources and exit with "ret". */
01031     nl_socket_free(sock);
01032     if (msg) nlmsg_free(msg);
01033     if (cb) free(cb);
01034     return ret;
01035 
01036 nla_put_failure:
01037     WAPI_ERROR("nla_put_failure!\n");
01038     ret = -1;
01039     goto exit;
01040 }
01041 
01042 
01043 int
01044 wapi_if_add(int sock, const char *ifname, const char *name, wapi_mode_t mode)
01045 {
01046     wapi_nl80211_ctx_t ctx;
01047     ctx.ifname = ifname;
01048     ctx.cmd = WAPI_NL80211_CMD_IFADD;
01049     ctx.u.ifadd.name = name;
01050     ctx.u.ifadd.mode = mode;
01051     return nl80211_cmd_handler(&ctx);
01052 }
01053 
01054 
01055 int
01056 wapi_if_del(int sock, const char *ifname)
01057 {
01058     wapi_nl80211_ctx_t ctx;
01059     ctx.ifname = ifname;
01060     ctx.cmd = WAPI_NL80211_CMD_IFDEL;
01061     return nl80211_cmd_handler(&ctx);
01062 }
